summary: This bill, the Employee Rights Act, primarily aims to reform US labor laws. Key provisions include amendments to the National Labor Relations Act regarding union elections, specifically addressing the eligibility of employees without lawful immigration status to vote. It also covers employee privacy concerning voter lists and union use of personal information. Further sections deal with independent contractor status, joint employer definitions, tribal sovereignty, independent negotiating rights for employees, restrictions on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives in collective bargaining agreements, modifications to laws concerning union violence, and protections against harassment in the workplace.
